alert.note: Alert for Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 9:14PM EDT until August 06 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Nottoway County in south central Virginia... * Until midnight EDT. * At 914 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blackstone, Nottoway, Fort Pickett, Spainville, Pattersons Store, Dominy Corner, Blackstone Airport, Wellville, Clay Store, North Wellville, Irby, Forkland and Murdocks. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
